contentrichtext.text: '''Marlene Warfield''' (born June 19, 1940 in [[Queens]], [[New York]]) is an [[United States|American]] actress. She has acted in films and American television. She portrayed the underground revolutionary Laureen Hobbs in the 1976 film ''[[Network (movie)|Network]]''<ref>Anderson, George. [http://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1129&dat=19761216&id=7n9IAAAAIBAJ&sjid=Tm0DAAAAIBAJ&pg=6873,1995000 "'Network' Dares Enough To Be The Very Best"] (Review). ''[[Pittsburgh Post-Gazette]]'', December 16, 1976, p. 19. Retrieved on May 30, 2013.</ref> and played the character of Victoria Butterfield on the television [[sitcom]] ''[[Maude (TV series)|Maude]]'' (1977â€“1978).<ref>''[[St. Petersburg Times]]''. [http://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=888&dat=19770912&id=ILhaAAAAIBAJ&sjid=YlkDAAAAIBAJ&pg=6867,3337223 "America's Cup Saluted with Music"]. September 12, 1977, p. 7D. Retrieved on May 30, 2013.</ref> She also played Clara in ''[[The Great White Hope (film)|The Great White Hope]]'' in 1970.<ref>Drew, Bernard. [http://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1982&dat=19701017&id=tjtHAAAAIBAJ&sjid=JysNAAAAIBAJ&pg=2009,3104199 "'Great White Hope' Made into Good Movie"] (Review). ''The Evening News'', October 17, 1970, p. 6. Retrieved on May 30, 2013.</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == * {{IMDB name|0912200}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Warfield, Marlene | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American actor | DATE OF BIRTH = June 19, 1940 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Warfield, Marlene}} [[Category:1940 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:African-American actors]] [[Category:People from Queens, New York]] {{US-tv-actor-1940s-stub}}
